description: landscape with dark shadows/foliage at lower right; line of tall trees with thin trunks in front of a thatch-roofed house at left middle ground; village buildings and church in background at right
marks:
Signature and Inscription

LRC, in black: illegi LRC, in black: [A LEPÈRE]
medium: Gouache, chalk, and watercolor heightened with white over graphite on board
text: These chatty trees, grazed with yellow pastel, reflect Auguste Lepère’s delight in Saint-Jean-de-Monts, the French coastal town where he spent summers after 1892. Before the widespread use of photo-based illustrations, Lepère produced precise wood engravings for Parisian magazines. In the countryside he showed more abandon, as seen in the loose pencil underdrawing here. Minute by minute the blue-hued shadow moves across the yellow field, soon to engulf the unsuspecting trees.
title: St.-Jean-de-Monts
